A great game to play with friends. There are a bunch of different aspects in the game to which not all gameplay is the same. Different teammates and killers, really makes you think of how to strategize.

I'd say the only downside is the bugs and glitches that comes with the games.. always something that comes up to ruin the game for most. Hitboxes are always an issue, but if you dont mind that, I'd say its worth a try.

I have played this game since like 2018 and I'm too attached to stop playing but god this game is a hot pile of garbage that drains you, the concept is amazing and the mixture of licensed and original characters is always cool but the devs just cash grab as much as they can and don't really listen to issues along with the try-hard sweaty community that surrounds the game. As soon as someone else makes a game like dbd with better devs dbd is screwed and maybe at that point they'd listen but oh well.

This game is fun. That's all I have to say that's positive. The community is extremely toxic, there are extremely broken perks, the devs ignore the community to the point where it seems like they're doing the opposite of what we want, they add new content that nobody asked for instead of fixing old problems that've been around forever, the devs have this idea that they can just look at data and get the info they need without looking at any of the context (which I will not go into because Scott Jund already did), the map can drastically change how the game goes which completely screws you over if you don't wanna spend map offerings, and plenty of things are too weak and too strong. But yeah this games super fun, I like it, I play it a lot.

Playing as either the killer or the survivor is really fun. Either hunting four people around to their ultimate doom, or playing as one of four survivors working together to escape the map and live to tell the tale. The devs of this game are great. Going from the old textures to the newer ones blew my mind, from decent good looking textures to great smooth and clean textures.

A fun game that's a bit different from the usual. Unique killers and survivors can keep things fresh but it comes at a price.

If you're not spending money, then it's going to take several hundred hours to get a good cast of characters. For killers, you'll start with 5 of 22. After 29 hrs, I have 1/3 of the points needed to buy one character, and the premiums are only available for cash. So be ready to toss an extra $30 or more in DLC. 

Other than that, it's a stable game with a variety of maps. The player pool seems healthy. Balance is.. questionable but expected. And if you're shy or anxious, this game doesn't allow communication during a match. It's even rare to see people talk in the lobby. So don't fear any harsh judgments.

Edit: Further play. Paying for characters is more required as you move up the ranks. Not necessarily pay2win, but it's definitely advantageous.
